title: Toronto‚Äôs Brandon Ingram replaces injured Stephen Curry in 2026 NBA All-Star Game
description: This is Ingram's second All-Star Game. He leads the No. 5 seed Raptors scoring 22 points per game.
fullText:
Toronto's Brandon Ingram is an All-Star again.

Ingram has been selected by NBA Commissioner Adam Silver to replace the injured Stephen Curry on the USA Stripes team at the 2026 All-Star Game on Sunday in Los Angeles at the Intuit Dome (more on this year's format below).

Stephen Curry was voted an All-Star starter by the fans, but will sit out the game due to a case of "runner's knee," Warriors coach Steve Kerr announced Monday, as reported by Dalton Johnson at NBC Sports Bay Area.

This is Ingram's second All-Star appearance. He also played in the Chicago All-Star Game in 2020, when he was with the Pelicans, the year he won Most Improved Player.

This year, Ingram finished 10th in the Eastern Conference fan voting and eighth in the player voting. The only players who got more fan votes but are not in the game are Brooklyn's Michael Porter Jr. (day-to-day with a knee issue) and James Harden, who was recently traded from the Clippers ‚Äî who are hosting this All-Star Game ‚Äî to the Cavaliers.

Ingram earned this spot as the leading scorer on the No. 5-seeded Raptors, averaging 22 points, 5.8 rebounds, and 3.7 assists per game, with 33 games in which he scored 20 or more points.

This year, the NBA All-Star Game returns to NBC and debuts on Peacock ‚Äî and it falls right in the middle of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics. That was a perfect setup for the first-of-its-kind All-Star Game format, a USA vs. World showdown that fans and players have been asking for.

The 24 All-Star players have been divided into three teams, two USA teams ‚Äî USA Stripes and USA Stars ‚Äî and one World Team. Those three teams will compete in a round-robin tournament of four 12-minute games, each team playing at least two games.

The All-Star teams have been revealed!

Which team are you rolling with? pic.twitter.com/huNqFF6TWq

‚Äî NBA on NBC and Peacock (@NBAonNBC) February 4, 2026

At the end of the round-robin, the two top teams will play a championship game (the fourth 12-minute game of the day) for the title. (If there is a tie it comes down to point differential.)

The 75th NBA All-Star Game will take place on Sunday, Feb. 15, at 5 p.m. Eastern, an earlier time than in previous years, leading into more coverage of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

Every moment of All-Star Weekend ‚Äî the Rising Stars challenge on Friday. (Feb. 13), All-Star Saturday Night with the 3-Point Contest and Dunk Contest (Feb. 14), as well as the All-Star Game on Sunday, Feb. 15 ‚Äî will be broadcast on NBC and Peacock.

The 75th NBA All-Star Game will take place on Sunday, Feb. 15, at 5 p.m. Eastern, a time earlier than in previous years, leading into more coverage of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

Peacock NBA Monday will stream up to three Monday night games each week throughout the regular season. Coast 2 Coast Tuesday presents doubleheaders on Tuesday nights throughout the regular season on NBC and Peacock. On most Tuesdays, an 8 p.m. ET game will be on NBC stations in the Eastern and Central time zones, and an 8 p.m. PT game on NBC stations in the Pacific and often Mountain time zones.

Check local listings each week. Both games will stream live nationwide on Peacock. NBC Sports will launch Sunday Night Basketball across NBC and Peacock on Feb. 1, 2026. For a full schedule of the NBA on NBC and Peacock, click here.

 You'll also get tons of hit movies and TV shows, Originals, news, 24/7 channels, and current NBC & Bravo hits‚ÄîPeacock is here for whatever you're in the mood for.

title: Cam Skattebo and Chloe Rodriguez Reveal Their Relationship Rule amid His NFL Fame (Exclusive)
description: "He's been a superstar since I met him," says Skattebo‚Äôs girlfriend Chloe Rodriguez
fullText:
Chloe Rodriguez is praising her longtime boyfriend, Cam Skattebo

While speaking with PEOPLE at the EA Sports Madden Bowl, Rodriguez shared how she's navigating her boyfriend's viral fame

Rodriguez and Skattebo have been dating since college

Chloe Rodriguez is sharing her secrets to having a successful relationship with a partner in the NFL.

The influencer, 23, has been dating her boyfriend, New York Giants running back Cam Skattebo, since at least 2022, when the two were both attending California State University, Sacramento.

While chatting with PEOPLE at the EA Sports Madden Bowl on Feb. 6, over Super Bowl weekend in San Francisco, Calif., Rodriguez and Skattebo opened up about how they've navigated the pressures of Skattebo's NFL career.

Skattebo notes that the key to maintaining their relationship in the spotlight has been "not taking things too serious," with Rodriguez echoing that it was important to be "patient" with one another.

"Just living life," Skattebo continues.

Skattebo and Rodriguez also shared their reactions to Skattebo's multiple viral moments over the course of last year's NFL season. Skattebo made headlines after he did a backflip in the end zone during a Sept. 28 game against the Los Angeles Chargers.

"I mean, I had to get used to it, but it was different, but I've known that he's been like this, so he's been a superstar since I met him," Rodriguez says, of watching Skattebo build up a viral presence on and off the field.

"It's been awesome," Skattebo shares. "With everything that's been coming my way, I've been taking it in and being able to navigate it in the right way and it's been great."

Skattebo has become known for¬†nonstop backflips, an¬†aggressive playing style¬†and¬†running into telephone poles.

Skattebo's mother, Becky Skattebo, previously gave a glimpse into the untraditional tactics her 23-year-old son would practice in his younger years in hopes of going pro during an¬†ESPN¬†interview.

"He would put his brother's shoulder pads on and he would run into telephone poles," Becky told the outlet. "Once he got onto the field, it was no surprise the punishment he inflicted on his own body and everybody else."

Skattebo and Rodriguez first met in college, when Rodriguez was a part of the Hornets cheerleading squad.

Since then, she's been a staunch supporter of Skattebo. When he was selected by the New York Giants in the fourth round of the 2025 NFL Draft, she commemorated the occasion with a post on¬†Instagram¬†showing the two celebrating.

‚ÄúI love supporting you, keep making us proud," she wrote. "‚ù§Ô∏è time to head back east, go @nygiants!‚Äù

She was there to see the Giants play the Los Angeles Chargers in September 2025, and she sometimes wears her boyfriend‚Äôs custom SKATT chain when watching him play.

When Skattebo moved east to play for the Giants, Rodriguez joined him. In the summer of 2025, Rodriguez posted a photo of the N.Y.C. skyline on her¬†Instagram Stories, tagging Skattebo and Hoboken, N.J., alongside a house emoji.

title: Mets trade with White Sox for ex-Brewers 1.73 ERA reliever after rough 2025
description: The Mets are taking a chance on an intriguing lefty reliever.
fullText:
Mets trade with White Sox for ex-Brewers 1.73 ERA reliever after rough 2025 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The New York Mets have been very busy this offseason, making big free agent signings, swinging blockbuster trades, and overall, making plenty of roster moves to reshape the team.

It's been a lot of change for the Mets, and one of the areas with the most change has been in the bullpen. Edwin Diaz and Ryan Helsley are gone, while Devin Williams and Luke Weaver are coming to join the bullpen.

Most recently, the Mets made another bullpen addition. This time, according to Joel Sherman of The New York Post, the Mets are trading for lefty reliever Bryan Hudson from the Chicago White Sox. This is an interesting trade, and could be a sneaky good pickup.

"Sources: The Mets have acquired lefty reliever Bryan Hudson from the White Sox for cash," Sherman reports. "Hudson was DFAd a few days back."

The White Sox recently designated Hudson for assignment, and instead of letting him hit the open market, the Mets swooped in and offered the White Sox cash considerations to acquire Hudson.

Hudson is a 28-year-old left-handed reliever who's spent three years in the Major Leagues. His 2023 season came with the Los Angeles Dodgers, and it featured six appearances with a 7.27 ERA.

But in his next season, which came with the Brewers, Hudson put up a remarkable 1.73 ERA season in 43 appearances. He had 2.5 bWAR, 62 strikeouts, and 17 walks in 62.1 innings pitched. His 0.722 WHIP was also an incredible mark.

More:¬†Mets trade rumor on Brett Baty, Mark Vientos is unexpected update from Pirates

A 240 ERA+ was a very positive season for Hudson, and he was seemingly going to be a staple in the Brewers' bullpen for years to come.

But, he was traded mid-season in 2025 to the White Sox after posting a 4.35 ERA in 12 appearances in Milwaukee. With the White Sox, he posted a 5.79 ERA season, a massive drop-off from his dominance from a year prior.

While the Mets are adding a lefty reliever who has two rough seasons, with a .7.27 ERA and 4.80 ERA, his biggest sample size from 2024 is a lot more appealing.

This is a low-risk, high-reward trade for the Mets. A good Spring Training, and Hudson could be a key piece of the Mets' bullpen for the 2026 MLB season.

title: Justin Jefferson comments on Vikings QB situation before offseason
description: Justin Jefferson opened up about the Vikings quarterback situation while making the media rounds.
fullText:
The Minnesota Vikings quarterback situation will be fluid in 2026. The team has J.J. McCarthy with thom they are looking to build with next season, but they need much better insurance behind him to avoid another collapse like the season they just experienced.

What will be a rock for whoever is under center for the team is wide receiver Justin Jefferson. The All-Pro is arguably the best player in the NFL at the position and is coming off yet another 1,000-plus yard season despite the ups and downs he experienced from quarterbacks.

As the leader of the team, Jefferson was asked about the situation with J.J. McCarthy during Super Bowl week.

Jefferson said, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not my decision. I don't care who‚Äôs throwing me that ball. That‚Äôs not my main priority‚Ä¶ that person that‚Äôs throwing that ball needs to throw that ball, and lead us to into that big dance at the end of the season. Right now, J.J. (McCarthy) is my QB. For me, it‚Äôs to get him to where we need to go. . .‚Äù

"As of right now, JJ [McCarthy] is my quarterback. For me, it's to get him to where we need to go."

Vikings WR Justin Jefferson on his QB and holding teammates accountable@JJettas2 | @heykayadams pic.twitter.com/l9LBBswE4e

‚Äî Up & Adams (@UpAndAdamsShow) February 4, 2026

The firing of general manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah opens the door for a change to occur, though it isn't expected. Make no mistake about it, this is a make-or-break year for both McCarthy and Jefferson for a variety of reasons. The Vikings need their star receiver to be happy, and they need to decide whether the former National Championship-winning passer can do that.

This article originally appeared on Vikings Wire: WR Justin Jefferson comments on Vikings QB situation

title: German Taubitz takes on Geisenberger's legacy with Olympic luge gold
description: German luger Julia Taubitz sped to victory in the singles on Tuesday to finally taste Olympic gold after eight world titles in various disciplines. She continues the strong German tradition in luge after the retired Natalie Geisenberger won the gold in 2014, 2018 and 2022.
fullText:
German luger Julia Taubitz sped to victory in the singles on Tuesday to finally taste Olympic gold after eight world titles in various disciplines.

She continues the strong German tradition in luge after the retired Natalie Geisenberger won the gold in 2014, 2018 and 2022.

Taubitz was seventh at Beijing 2022 but triumphed in style in Cortina with a time of 3 minutes 30.625 seconds from the four runs. She had taken over at the top of the standings after a track record on run 2 and never looked back.

Latvia's Elina Bota took silver and US luger Ashley Farquharson was third.

Taubitz's compatriot and Olympic debutant Merle Fr√§bel missed a medal in eighth despite leading after the first run, with a big mistake at the start on the third run costing her dearly. German Anna Berreiter, silver medallist in 2022, was sixth.

title: Roger Federer reacts on Instagram after attending Super Bowl LX
description: Roger Federer was among the celebrities in attendance at Super Bowl LX, where the Seattle Seahawks met the New England Patriots. The Seahawks emerged victorious as 29-13 champions, with the iconic match having been played at Levi‚Äôs Stadium in California.
fullText:
Roger Federer was among the celebrities in attendance at Super Bowl LX, where the Seattle Seahawks met the New England Patriots.

The Seahawks emerged victorious as 29-13 champions, with the iconic match having been played at Levi‚Äôs Stadium in California.

Tennis icon Federer took in the action in Santa Clara, where a superb defensive display helped the Seahawks get over the line.

He was one of 70,823 fans in attendance, where the world-famous half-time show was performed by Bad Bunny.

Federer has now taken to social media to describe the experience, where he also made it onto the pitch.

Sharing images on his Instagram, the Swiss legend wrote: ‚ÄúSuper Bowl LX. Amazing trip back out to the Bay Area.‚Äù

Justin Bieber, Adam Sandler, Lewis Hamilton and Travis Kelce among many other high-profile names also attended.

It‚Äôs been a very busy year so far for 44-year-old Federer, who only just returned to Melbourne for the Australian Open.

Federer played in an exhibition match at the start of the Grand Slam, before hanging around to watch some of the action.

His fellow legend Rafael Nadal was also in attendance in Australia, where Carlos Alcaraz lifted the trophy and completed the career Grand Slam.

He beat Novak Djokovic in the final, with the Serbian involved in a long-standing debate with Federer and Nadal.

Many tennis fans continue to argue which of the three is the greatest player of all time, with Djokovic the only one still playing.

Federer still loves his tennis, but he retired from the sport in 2022, while Nadal called time on his career in 2024.

Notably, it is Djokovic who leads the way in the men‚Äôs all-time Grand Slam titles list on 24, followed by Nadal‚Äôs 22 and Federer‚Äôs 20.

title: 49ers exit interviews, OL: There‚Äôs a glaring hole holding the offensive line back
description: The 49ers offensive line may have exceeded expectations in 2025, but the need to upgrade at left guard is crucial to success in 2026 and beyond
fullText:
The San Francisco 49ers have plenty of moving parts on offense during 2025. Trent Williams began the season playing next to Ben Bartch, but that only lasted a game and nine snaps. From Connor Colby back to Bartch, splitting time with Spencer Burford, the Niners couldn‚Äôt find any consistency at left guard until the final month of the season.

The offensive line also needed to adjust to life without George Kittle early in the season, and that wasn‚Äôt even the biggest adjustment. After a summer of getting used to hearing Brock Purdy‚Äôs cadence, Mac Jones started the second game of the season and the majority of the first half.

All in all, especially factoring in expectations, you could argue that the 49ers‚Äô offensive line overachieved and was a strength in 2025. After it became routine during games for fans to shout, ‚ÄúBench Jake Brendel!‚Äù or ‚ÄúTake Colton McKivitz out!‚Äù, those two had arguably their best seasons as pros.

That‚Äôs not to say changes are needed. Age is becoming a concern for a couple of starters. That could be addressed either during the upcoming NFL Draft or through free agency. Before we look ahead, let‚Äôs discuss some of the strengths and weaknesses of the offensive line.

It‚Äôs tricky when you play with one quarterback who wants to get the ball out quickly, while the other quarterback has zero issues holding the ball in hopes of making a play. The 49ers‚Äô scheme and quarterback play affect some of these numbers. Still, giving your quarterback, on average, the sixth-longest time to throw in 2025 is a sign that things are going well up front. San Francisco also finished 11th in sack percentage allowed and was 13th in time to pressure.

Individually, the 49ers had some stellar performances that are worthy of being highlighted.

Second-year pro Dominick Puni was battling an injury that kept him out for the first month and a half of the season. But from Week 7 on, Puni pitched multiple shutouts and really had one ‚Äúbad‚Äù game.

Center Jake Brendel finished 19th among all offensive linemen in blown block rate as a pass protector.

The scheme helped protect everybody else thanks to the 37-year-old left tackle playing on an island. It wasn‚Äôt Trent Williams‚Äô best year, but he was asked to do far more than anybody else, and the 49ers‚Äô identity up front still revolves around its left tackle.

Brendel, Puni, and Colton McKivitz were all top 23 in Sports Info Solutions‚Äô ‚Äúrun block points earned‚Äù stat. Only four linemen in the league had a lower blown block rate than McKivitz did. Williams finished in the top 30 in that same stat.

The offensive line is all about cohesion, and if one position is off, it ruins it for the entire unit. You‚Äôll notice everybody above was highlighted outside of left guard. It‚Äôs tough to fault Connor Colby for struggling. He was a seventh-round rookie thrown into the fire. The same is true for Spencer Burford, who had some intriguing moments late in the year but was far from consistent.

So, despite having quality run blockers up and down the line, the Niners finished middle of the pack in ‚Äústuffed percentage,‚Äù or a run results in zero or negative yardage, rushing success rate, and allowed the fourth-worst yards before contact in the NFL.

During the first couple of months of the season, you could see how the revolving door at left guard impacted the running game. Run plays to the left with Williams not knowing who to block were a sign that somebody messed up. We can probably throw the tight ends in the mix here, too.

Colby and Burford both had blown block rates of 6.3 in pass pro. Aaron Banks had his worst season in 2024, with a 3.3 blown-block rate in pass protection. The 49ers made the mistake of thinking they could replace Banks with a veteran who hadn‚Äôt stayed healthy throughout his career, and paid for it by having to play players they had no intention of playing once Bartch went down.

Trent Williams is under contract for one more season. An extension will give the 49ers an extra $16.8 million in 2026, making the move a no-brainer, despite him being 38 come 2026.

Brendel‚Äôs contract is also up after next year, so the center position becomes a priority in this draft. Brendel will turn 34, and his backup, Matt Hennessy, is an unrestricted free agent.

Puni‚Äôs rookie deal runs through 2027, while McKivitz is under contract through the 2028 season.

Bartch and Burford are unrestricted free agents, meaning left guard is near the top of the list of needs.

Banks was the highest pick the team used on an offensive lineman since Mike McGlinchey. Puni was a third-rounder. That might be the ceiling when it comes to adding an offensive lineman.

The 49ers should go back to the Iowa well. Beau Stephens would be an upgrade at left guard and could even potentially slide over to center if need be. At his size, Stephens should be available on Day 3.

If the 49ers want to convert a tackle to guard on Day 3 as they did with Puni, Duke‚Äôs Brian Parker fits the bill. He‚Äôs been Duke‚Äôs right tackle for the previous two seasons. He started at left tackle a handful of times. That experience, as well as being a first-team all-conference player, should attract the 49ers. Parker‚Äôs competitiveness stands out, as does his first couple of steps out of his stance. Parker played guard and center at the Shrine Bowl, so the transition has already begun.

The biggest issue with Burford and Colby was their inaccurate strike timing. That‚Äôs a strength for Parker, who is disciplined and strong enough to anchor against a bull rush. It‚Äôs worth pointing out that Parker is somewhat stiff and high-cut, which will only be exposed more at the NFL level.

The 49ers should use multiple Day 3 picks on the offensive line with the hopes of finding a starter, but at worst, upgrading their depth.

title: 2 moves for Colts to create over $21 million in salary cap space
description: These two moves can create over $21 million in additional salary cap space for the Indianapolis Colts during the 2026 offseason.
fullText:
The Indianapolis Colts are in a good position salary-cap-wise this offseason. However, there is always the opportunity to create more space, depending on how aggressive GM Chris Ballard wants to be.

When owner Carlie Irsay-Gordon spoke with the media after the season, she mentioned how¬†Ballard adapted¬†his roster-building approach, which included being more aggressive.

Ballard then¬†seemed to acknowledge¬†that continuing down that path was going to be the plan this offseason.

While veteran cuts are perhaps the most well-known avenue for creating cap space, and Michael Pittman could be one of those candidates, contract extensions are another way to generate space.

Although a lot of new money is being added to the contract, there's also more years being added as well, creating a longer runway for current cap charges to be pushed to -- thus creating space in 2026.

Two contract extension candidates for the Colts are Jonathan Taylor and Quenton Nelson, both of whom are entering the final year of their current deals.

Taylor put together yet another highly productive season in 2025. He finished the season with 1,585 rushing yards -- the third-most in football. He also led the league in total touchdowns.

The 2025 season was another very good one for Nelson as well. Among all guards this season, Nelson ranked fourth in pass-blocking efficiency and fourth in run-blocking grade.

Both players were Pro Bowlers, and Nelson was a second-team All-Pro.

If the Colts wanted to extend Taylor and maximize their cap-savings in the process, OTC projects that would create $8.62 million in cap savings. With Nelson, the Colts could potentially create up to $13.36 million in space.

Now, the downside to this is that both players' cap charges down the road would be inflated even higher, but this offseason, it would give Ballard more cap flexibility to attack free agency.

This article originally appeared on Colts Wire: How Colts can create $21 million in added salary cap space

title: 2026 Fantasy Baseball Catcher Tiered Rankings: Cal Raleigh, William Contreras lead group of 'Big Ticket' backstops
description: Scott Pianowski begins his series of 2026 fantasy baseball rankings tiers starting with the catcher position.
fullText:
With the fresh fantasy baseball season approaching, it‚Äôs time to get you some tiered rankings from my Shuffle Up series. Use these for auction drafts, straight drafts, keeper decisions or merely a view of how the position ebbs and flows. We‚Äôll kick off the series with catcher.

The numbers are unscientific in nature and meant to reflect where talent clusters and drops off. Assume a 5x5 scoring system, as usual.

Additional positions will follow regularly for the next two weeks.

Raleigh‚Äôs expected regression season will likely bring him down to something like a .235 average with 40 homers. The Mariners will use him every day, giving him DH time when he needs a defensive rest. Last year was more fun on the road, away from the Marine layer: .267/.380/.619, with 32 of the home runs. The depth of the catcher position keeps me from taking Raleigh in Round 2, while still respecting him as a rankings outlier.

Last year was the weakest in four seasons for Milwaukee‚Äôs Contreras and he still checked in as the C4, buoyed by his run production and on-base skills. He‚Äôs resourceful enough to steal the occasional base and last year‚Äôs .260 average is probably his floor. Stepping into an age-28 season, I could consider Contreras at his current Yahoo ADP in the low 60s.

Goodman‚Äôs batting average crashed by 59 points on the road, but he also conked 18 road homers and had similar slugging percentages in both columns. The Rockies prioritize him in the lineup, giving him 39 starts at DH. Although the Colorado lineup lacks the depth of past seasons, Goodman at least will be in the top half of the order, where the production is. He‚Äôs still a decent value in the mid-80s for Yahoo ADP.

Ram√≠rez‚Äôs Yahoo ADP continues to lag about 50 picks behind his global ADP, and although some of that is noise from two-catcher versus one-catcher formats, it still reflects an opportunity. Ram√≠rez already has plus power, shows the willingness to run, and can at least approach a neutral average as his plate discipline matures.

Although the best hitting backstops will routinely see DH time when they‚Äôre not available to catch, Smith doesn‚Äôt have that luxury in L.A. with Shohei Ohtani locking up the DH slot. It means Smith will probably have top-five rate stats at the position, but his counting numbers ‚Äî despite being in a loaded lineup ‚Äî will be mildly disappointing.

I had to take Rice‚Äôs price down a buck when Paul Goldschmidt re-signed in New York, likely setting up a platoon situation at first base. Rice still gets the heavier side, of course, and you like his career trajectory as he prepares for his age-27 season. You can‚Äôt blame the Yanks for giving Rice a partner after he slashed .208/.271/.481 against southpaws, though there‚Äôs also the idea of letting him play all the time and see if growth happens. The Yankees rank first and third in runs scored over the last two years, so we like to invest here.

Diaz lost a chunk of his average last year, but bad luck was at play ‚Äî his BABIP fell by 61 points and his expected stats (.268 average, .465 slugging) validate his bat. You‚Äôd like a few more walks, but 18-20 homers are in play, and he‚Äôs still holding a career .279 average. Houston‚Äôs lineup is no longer a playland ‚Äî the Astros were 21st in runs last season.

$10 Gabriel Moreno, Diamondbacks

Rutschman was a god as a rookie, very good his second year, tailed off in Year 3 and collapsed last season. Okay, oblique injuries were part of the story, but what especially concerns me is that Rutschman‚Äôs career arc closely tracks to Matt Wieters; same team, same position. Wieters had his best WAR seasons at age 25 and 26 but was hurt and/or ineffective the rest of his career. I‚Äôll allow my heart to root for a Rutschman turnaround, but I can‚Äôt spend fantasy capital on him.

Realmuto still bats for a credible average, but the power continues to fade ‚Äî he slugged just .384 last year. He also had a 91 OPS+ in 2025, the first time in a decade he‚Äôs been a below-average offensive player. Stepping into his age-35 season, it‚Äôs a good time to eschew Realmuto, even with an inexpensive ADP. Player development is not always linear, but player decline almost always is.

I'll target Alvarez with the Mets, looking for an inexpensive way to tap into what's likely a top-five offense. Alvarez is still only 24 and just needs a reasonable health runout to push into the top 10 at the position. He's already given us a 25-homer season, and his walk rate continues to creep forward.

title: Nikola Topiƒá commended for 'unbelievable' comeback with G League debut
description: After a testicular cancer diagnosis in October, Thunder guard Nikola Topiƒá returned to competitive action on Monday after suiting up in the G League.
fullText:
After a testicular cancer diagnosis, Oklahoma City Thunder guard Nikola Topiƒá returned to competitive action on Monday after logging 16 minutes in the G League.

Thunder general manager Sam Presti¬†announced on Oct. 30¬†that Topiƒá was diagnosed after undergoing a biopsy in Houston, Texas. He immediately started chemotherapy to treat the cancer, which was completed in early January, his agent announced.

The 20-year-old¬†was assigned to the OKC Blue on Sunday, clearing the way for him to suit up in his first game in two seasons. He finished with seven points, seven assists and one rebound in a 137-135 victory over the Sioux Falls Skyforce.

"It is a great accomplishment," Thunder coach Mark Daigneault said. "I can't say enough about him as a guy -- his mental toughness, maturity, resilience. To think of where he is at: He sat out with an ACL last year. He hasn't played a lot of basketball over the last two years. He comes off a one-year rehab and immediately has a very surprising diagnosis and goes through chemotherapy, three rounds of it."

Nikola Topiƒá with two quick assists ‚ö°Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/YHOiiWgV7g

‚Äî OKC BLUE (@okcblue) February 10, 2026

Topiƒá continued working out and training at the team practice facility while receiving chemotherapy. He was eventually seen participating in pregame on-court workouts with the group in an effort to return to game action, either in the G League or NBA.

The Serbian was sidelined all of last year after undergoing surgery to repair a torn left ACL suffered while playing with Crvena zvezda in the ABA League Finals in May 2024. He played in summer league and the preseason before receiving his diagnosis.

The Thunder rallied around Topiƒá throughout his treatment and was thrilled to see him playing basketball again. While it remains to be seen what the future holds for Topiƒá this season, the organization is certainly just ecstatic he is back on the court.

"For him to work himself back to the court is just an unbelievable accomplishment," Daigneault said. "We're incredibly happy for him. His teammates have been very supportive during this process. We're all just collectively thrilled that he is back playing basketball. I know he has missed it a great deal. This is just so good for him, mentally, to get his feet back underneath him."

This article originally appeared on Rookie Wire: Thunder news: Nikola Topiƒá commended for 'unbelievable' comeback

title: üö® Media: Decision made, another twist in the Ronaldo strike
description: Will everything be good again between Cristiano Ronaldo and Al-Nassr? The Portuguese player recently went on strike for two games. Among other things, he expressed dissatisfaction with his club's tran...
fullText:
Will everything be good again between Cristiano Ronaldo and Al-Nassr? The Portuguese player recently went on strike for two games. Among other things, he expressed dissatisfaction with his club's transfer policy.

According to reports, Al-Nassr spent too little money on new players. The club is majority-owned by the state fund (PIF). This same state fund reportedly also failed to pay some of the club's staff.

CR7 then decided to go on strike, and even a return to Europe was on the table. Now, the Portuguese player seems to have made a decision.

According to 'ESPN' and 'A Bola', Ronaldo will end his strike. Reports indicate that, among other things, the missing salaries have been paid. This is a reason for Ronaldo to play for his club again. He reportedly wants to be on the field for the league match against Al Fateh on Saturday.

However, the superstar will miss tomorrow's game in the AFC Champions League 2. Al-Nassr will face Arkadag then.

title: Ashley Farquharson wins bronze for second-ever U.S. Olympic medal in women‚Äôs luge
description: CORTINA D‚ÄôAMPEZZO, Italy ‚Äî Ashley Farquharson won bronze in the women‚Äôs luge singles Tuesday, just the second Olympic women‚Äôs luge medal in U.S. history. Germany‚Äôs Julia Taubitz took gold with a total time of 3:30.625, while Latvia‚Äôs Elina Bota (3:31.
fullText:
CORTINA D‚ÄôAMPEZZO, Italy ‚Äî Ashley Farquharson won bronze in the women‚Äôs luge singles Tuesday, just the second Olympic women‚Äôs luge medal in U.S. history.

Germany‚Äôs Julia Taubitz took gold with a total time of 3:30.625, while Latvia‚Äôs Elina Bota (3:31.543) won silver. Farquharson was third at 3:31.582.

It is the first women‚Äôs luge medal for America since Erin Hamlin won bronze at the 2014 Sochi Games.

Luge, where athletes slide while lying on their back on a sled down an icy track and can reach speeds of more than 90 miles per hour, is all about the start ‚Äî as in, your first few runs. The competition is split over two days, and if sliders don‚Äôt turn in good times for their first or second runs, their only hope at a medal is if someone in front of them makes a big mistake.

That‚Äôs exactly what happened Tuesday.

All events have concluded. See full medal count.

Germany‚Äôs Merle Malou Fraebel started Tuesday in second place and was a contender for gold. But as she got settled on the sled for her third run, she banged around the track and had to put a foot down on the ice to steady herself. That cost her precious time, and she plummeted down the standings, ultimately finishing eighth.

That opened the door for Farquharson, who had two excellent runs on the first day of competition. Farquharson started Tuesday in fifth place, but after a stellar third run leapfrogged Italy‚Äôs Verena Hofer to move into third place. She held on to that in the fourth and final run.

Cortina is Farquharson‚Äôs second Olympics; at the 2022 Beijing Games, she finished 12th in women‚Äôs singles.

Her teammates Emily Fischnaller and Summer Britcher finished 12th and 14th, respectively. Fischnaller was competing in her third Olympics, and her fifth-place finish is up from 26th in Beijing. She also broke her neck at the 2018 Olympics in Pyeongchang.

Britcher was believed to be the American most likely to medal coming into Cortina, but a rough first day of sliding put her out of podium contention almost immediately. Milan Cortina was Britcher‚Äôs fourth Olympics, and 14th is her best finish yet. She was 23rd in Beijing in 2022, 19th in 2018 and 15th in 2014.

This article originally appeared in The Athletic.

title: Patriots QB Drake Maye has no plans for surgery on his throwing shoulder this offseason
description: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye said he doesn't plan to have any surgical procedures on his throwing shoulder this offseason, after receiving a pain-relieving injection before their Super Bowl loss.  The Patriots returned to the team facility to have meetings with the coaching staff and pack up their lockers before heading out for the offseason.  Despite the long playoff run, Maye said he doesn't think he put any extra stress on this arm this season.
fullText:
FOXBOROUGH, Mass. (AP) ‚Äî New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye said he doesn't plan to have any surgical procedures on his throwing shoulder this offseason, after receiving a pain-relieving injection before their Super Bowl loss.

‚ÄúJust get some time off. Time's the best healer. Definitely just need time off,‚Äù Maye said Tuesday. ‚ÄúNothing that needs anything to be done. Just some time away and time to get some rest and time away from football.‚Äù

The Patriots returned to the team facility to have meetings with the coaching staff and pack up their lockers before heading out for the offseason.

Despite the long playoff run, Maye said he doesn't think he put any extra stress on this arm this season.

‚ÄúI think it's a case of having one hit in the AFC championship game that was just kind of unfortunate,‚Äù Maye said. ‚ÄúUnfortunate timing, the two weeks (before the Super Bowl) was great to have off to have a chance to be out there for my guys. You can't blame things on injuries. Things happen like this all the time in the league. ... You can't (blame) it on one little thing, the shoulder. ... I was feeling like I was able to make throws in the game and was myself."

Maye threw two touchdown passes but was sacked six times, had two interceptions and lost a fumble that Seattle turned into another touchdown in New England‚Äôs 29-13 loss.

Patriots left tackle Will Campbell revealed Tuesday that a torn ligament in his knee sent him to injured reserve for four games late in the regular season.

Campbell had a disastrous performance in the the Super Bowl, giving up a pair of sacks on Maye as the Seahawks sent several blitzes to his side of the line. According to Next Gen Stats, Campbell allowed 14 pressures, the most allowed by any NFL player in a game this season.

‚ÄúIt obviously wasn‚Äôt 100%,‚Äù Campbell told reporters. ‚ÄúI mean, I don‚Äôt think when you tear a ligament in your knee, it‚Äôs not going to be how it was before, but I was healthy enough to go. I‚Äôm not going to say that it held me back, but it wasn‚Äôt the same as it was before, obviously."

Campbell was carted off the field in the second half of the Patriots‚Äô 26-20 win at Cincinnati in Week 12. That ended the 2025 fourth overall draft pick's string of 12 straight starts as Maye‚Äôs blindside protector. But he started the season finale and all four playoff games.

He said he understands the criticism he received for his Super Bowl performance.

‚ÄúIt comes with the job when you don‚Äôt perform,‚Äù Campbell said. ‚ÄúObviously, I was picked high, paid a lot, so people expect a certain thing, and I expect more myself,‚Äù he said. "So, whenever I don‚Äôt perform ... obviously it sucks, but it doesn‚Äôt suck for anyone more than it sucks for me.‚Äù

Vrabel said he's confident Campbell will grow from this season and doesn't plan to move him to another position.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs 22 years old. He‚Äôs our left tackle. He‚Äôll get better. He‚Äôll get stronger,‚Äù Vrabel said. ‚ÄúWe aren‚Äôt moving Will to guard, center, tight end or anywhere else.‚Äù

Maye, who has developed a close friendship with Campbell off the field, said he believes his future is bright.

‚ÄúThe expectations of a first-round pick, I think he‚Äôs dealt with so much this year," Maye said. "It‚Äôs going to be great for him in the future. He‚Äôs going to be a great player in this league, he already is a great player in this league. ‚Ä¶ I love Will. I look forward to playing with him for a long time.‚Äù

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/NFL

title: Steve Spurrier has a message for Dabo Swinney, Clemson about tampering
description: Florida man Steve Spurrier delivers a response to Dabo Swinney after Clemson turned Ole Miss into the NCAA for tampering.
fullText:
Steve Spurrier has a message for Clemson football coach Dabo Swinney.

The "Head Ball Coach" was asked about by a reporter on Monday about Swinney publicly calling out Ole Miss coach Pete Golding and Rebels general manager Austin Thomas for tampering with linebacker Luke Ferrelli, who enrolled at Clemson and was in team meetings before joining Mississippi.

"I thought by now somebody would have told Dabo: 'Dabo, there ain't no rules anymore,'" Spurrier said with a laugh in response to a question from WYFF-TV's Marc Whiteman.

"There are (rules) still on the books I guess back there about, 'You can't do it after this date or that date.' Gosh, (in) basketball, they got pros coming back to play in college there, so I don't know. I don't know if they're ever going to enforce any rules now or not."

"But I think Dabo has learned now that he's got to start paying his players just like everybody else is, or you'll get left behind... You can complain, but I don't know how good it's going to do."

"There's no rules. Somebody tell Dabo there's no rules now," Spurrier repeated.

Steve Spurrier talked to reporters today on a Zoom ahead of his induction into the SC Athletic Hall of Fame.

He was asked by ‚Å¶@MarcWYFFNews4‚Å© about Dabo Swinney‚Äôs calling out of Ole Miss for tampering.

Spurrier says ‚ÄúSomeone has to tell Dabo there are no rules now.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/qLifbBNcqe

‚Äî Jon Blau (@Jon_Blau) February 9, 2026

Spurrier is the latest prominent figure to weigh in on the tampering saga, which Swinney highlighted in rigorous detail at a news conference on Jan. 23.

During the news conference, Swinney said that he had turned Ole Miss into the NCAA for "blatant tampering."

"I've always just stayed in my lane and handled my business, and I've stayed focused on Clemson," Swinney said at the time. "But I'm not going to let someone just flat out tamper with my program. If you tamper with my players, I'm going to turn you in."

Several prominent college football voices have come to Swinney's defense, including Fox Sports top game analyst Joel Klatt.

"Dabo is absolutely right," Klatt said recently. ‚ÄúHe's right, and yet we need more guys like Dabo to step forward and say: 'govern us.'"

‚ÄúThe reality of the situation is, something has to put a stop to this," added ESPN's Tom Luginbill. "Because this is the problem. It‚Äôs not name, image and likeness. It‚Äôs not the transfer portal. It‚Äôs tampering."

Former coach Urban Meyer, whose Ohio State teams met Clemson in the College Football Playoff and the Orange Bowl, also came to Swinney's defense. Meyer said Swinney did the right thing by turning in Ole Miss.

"I actually see people out there taking shots at Dabo," Meyer said in late January. "They call him a whiner. Why is he whiny? ‚Ä¶ Dabo's doing the right thing. Turn 'em in. Absolutely, turn 'em in. If nothing happens, there's no governance, there's no rules, and it'll be the most chaotic‚Ä¶ which it already is.‚Äù

South Carolina coach Shane Beamer has also sided with Swinney.

"I don't blame him," Beamer said of Swinney. "If that happened the way it's been described, that's a big deal. That's not a gray area. That's wrong.

"If you're going to have rules, then you have to enforce them. And if you don't enforce them, then what's the point? If someone is found guilty of doing that, I think the penalty should be severe."

Spurrier was 5-2 in seven meetings against Swinney as South Carolina's head coach before resigning in 2015. He will be inducted into the South Carolina Athletic Hall of Fame in May.

Clemson AD Graham Neff on the NCAA‚Äôs response to turning Ole Miss in https://t.co/rJAcSGBhVG pic.twitter.com/Da64YIsH7I

‚Äî Clemson Wire (@Clemson_Wire) January 27, 2026

Contact us¬†@Clemson_Wire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Clemson Tigers¬†news and notes, plus opinions.

This article originally appeared on Clemson Wire: Steve Spurrier has message for Dabo Swinney. Clemson about tampering

title: Detroit Tigers Sign Justin Verlander
description: The Detroit Tigers have signed Justin Verlander to a one-year contract for the 2026 season. A full breakdown of his career stats, legacy, and what he brings back to Detroit.
fullText:
The Detroit Tigers have officially brought a familiar face back home.

On Tuesday, the organization announced it has signed three-time American League Cy Young Award winner and nine-time All-Star Justin Verlander to a one-year contract for the 2026 season, marking a full-circle reunion for one of the greatest pitchers in franchise history.

‚ÄúWelcome home, JV!‚Äù the Tigers posted on social media following the announcement.

Verlander will receive $13M, $11M deferred, with payments starting in 2030, according to Jon Heyman.

The Tigers have signed three-time American League Cy Young and nine-time All-Star RHP Justin Verlander to a one-year contract for the 2026 season.

Welcome home, JV! pic.twitter.com/R1T1378gwn

‚Äî Detroit Tigers (@tigers) February 10, 2026

Verlander, now 42, was originally drafted by the Tigers second overall in the 2004 MLB Draft and made his major-league debut in 2005. Over parts of 13 seasons in Detroit, he became the face of the franchise‚Äôs golden era, helping lead the Tigers to multiple postseason runs and two World Series appearances.

Across his career, Verlander has built a r√©sum√© that places him among the all-time greats:

MVP, Rookie of the Year, Triple Crown

Even in 2025, Verlander proved he still has something left in the tank. In 29 starts, he logged 152 innings, struck out 137 batters, and posted a 3.85 ERA, showing he can still handle a regular rotation role.

While Verlander may no longer be the overpowering ace he once was, his value to Detroit extends far beyond the stat sheet.

A clubhouse leader with championship experience

For a young Tigers rotation still learning how to win consistently, Verlander‚Äôs presence could be invaluable both on and off the field.

Verlander‚Äôs return feels less about chasing accolades and more about legacy. Detroit is where his Hall of Fame case was built, and now he‚Äôll get the chance to finish his career wearing the uniform that made him a superstar.

If this truly is the final chapter, it‚Äôs hard to script a better ending.

The post Detroit Tigers Sign Justin Verlander appeared first on Detroit Sports Nation.

title: A Kirk Cousins reunion with the Minnesota Vikings is gaining steam
description: Kirk Cousins may find himself back in Minnesota quicker than many thought.
fullText:
The Minnesota Vikings and their quarterback discussion are not going anywhere anytime soon.

First-year starter J.J. McCarthy had a rollercoaster 2025 season, highlighted by poor play and injuries, which prevented him from proving himself. Production value aside, McCarthy not being available is perhaps his biggest drawback for the 2026 season. On the flip side, the team has also talked about adding a veteran behind him as a form of insurance, and coming out Super Bowl week, the perfect fit may be emerging.

Insider Diana Russini discussed various moves that were being rumored during Super Bowl week, and one of them could affect the Vikings. She discussed how Cousins could be on the move, and she mentioned a fit could be found with Minnesota. She writes, "I‚Äôm watching to see if the Falcons find any parties interested in their backup. Speaking of those Vikings, one league source speculated that Cousins could be an option there, given his history with Kevin O‚ÄôConnell and Minnesota‚Äôs desire to bring in competition for young J.J. McCarthy."

Cousins would be perhaps too aggressive a move for the team to make, but it is one that makes sense for the team. He played well, replacing Michael Penix Jr. down the stretch for the Falcons, and he could save the season for the Vikings if called up.

title: Former Cy Young Award winner, 43, signs $13 million contract where his MLB career began
description: Justin Verlander is taking his career back where it began. According to Jeff Passan of ESPN, Verlander and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a new contract for the 2026 season. The 43-year-old pitcher won the American League MVP‚Ä¶
fullText:
Justin Verlander is taking his career back where it began.

As first reported by Bob Nightengale of USA Today, Verlander and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a new contract for the 2026 season. The 43-year-old pitcher won the American League MVP award with the Tigers in 2011, after winning the AL Rookie of the Year Award for Detroit in 2006.

One year, $13 million, with $11 million deferred starting in 2030. https://t.co/qvHlrcUKVg

‚Äî Bob Nightengale (@BNightengale) February 10, 2026

Nightengale and others report the Tigers will pay Verlander $13 million ‚Äî all but $2 million of which will be deferred to future seasons. It‚Äôs a sensible contract for a pitcher who was the highest-paid player in the game as recently as 2023.

Verlander has won three Cy Young Awards in a 20-year career that will one day land him in the Baseball Hall of Fame.

Last season, Verlander went 4-11 with a 3.85 ERA in 29 starts for the San Francisco Giants. Despite his poor record, Verlander made 29 starts and struck out 137 batters over 152 innings. His 3.85 FIP matched the one he posted in 2023 for the New York Mets and Houston Astros, when he pitched 162.1 innings with a 3.22 ERA.

In Detroit, Verlander will join a deep rotation that helped the Tigers win the American League Central division in 2025. He won‚Äôt have to be a star; ace left-hander Tarik Skubal is the two-time reigning Cy Young Award winner in the American League.

Framber Valdez, Jack Flaherty, Casey Mize, and Reese Olson round out a rotation that will allow Verlander to give as much or as little as his right arm allows after making 555 regular season starts, and 37

title: Roger not out. Maltbie returns to television for five key PGA Tour events this year
description: NBC and Golf Channel decided in 2023 not to renew the deal for Roger Maltbie, one of the more popular voices in golf.  Golf Digest reported that Maltbie has a deal to work five PGA Tour events for Golf Channel, in his familiar spot on the ground on the weekdays and part of the lead-in coverage to the weekend.
fullText:
PEBBLE BEACH, Calif. (AP) ‚Äî NBC and Golf Channel decided in 2023 not to renew the deal for Roger Maltbie, one of the more popular voices in golf. He is best known for his line, ‚ÄúIt's just not a fair fight,‚Äù when Tiger Woods won the U.S. Open at Pebble Beach by 15 shots.

Television viewers haven't heard the last of Maltbie.

Golf Digest reported that Maltbie has a deal to work five PGA Tour events for Golf Channel, in his familiar spot on the ground on the weekdays and part of the lead-in coverage to the weekend. And some of the venues won't be so familiar.

It starts this week at Pebble Beach, a special place for Maltbie, who grew up in the Bay Area. He also will be at the Memorial (this is the 50th anniversary of his win at Muirfield Village) and the new Cadillac Championship at Doral. Those are CBS productions. Maltbie's entire career was at NBC.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something I am really looking forward to, working with Jim Nantz and the CBS team, because it‚Äôs something I‚Äôve never done before,‚Äù Maltbie told Golf Digest. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been on opposite deals, so that‚Äôs going to be interesting. You know, this is what I like to do. And I do what I‚Äôm told to do. Maybe that‚Äôs why they still use me some.‚Äù

The other tournaments are Bay Hill and The Players Championship.

Maltbie signed a separate deal with NBC, as he has done in the past, to work the U.S. Open, U.S. Senior Open and the Senior PGA Championship.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited that they still want me to do this, and I guess they feel like I am still someone viewers want to listen to,‚Äù said Maltbie, 74, who first worked TV at the 1989 Ryder Cup. ‚ÄúThe bottom line is that I want to keep going because I‚Äôm a fan of the game.‚Äù

Chris Gotterup is joining a small and most unusual group when he goes to Augusta National in April. He will be only the third player since World War II to have won four times on the PGA Tour before playing in the Masters for the first time.

According to the Elias Sports Bureau, the others were Dave Hill in 1968 and Mark Wilson in 2011.

Gotterup won in Myrtle Beach in 2024 for his first PGA Tour title, but that was an opposite-field event that doesn't come with an automatic Masters invitation. He won the Scottish Open last July, which made him eligible for the Masters. And then he won the Sony Open and Phoenix Open.

Wilson won the 2007 Honda Classic for his first title, but it wasn't until the following year the Masters returned to inviting winners of PGA Tour events that offered full FedEx Cup points. He won the Mayakoba Golf Classic in 2009 when it was held opposite the Match Play.

Wilson qualified for the Masters by winning the Sony Open in 2011, and then he won the Phoenix Open a month later.

Hill won four times in the 1960s, a time when the Masters was heavy on major champions, invitations and amateurs.

For example, the year after Hill won twice in 1961, Augusta National invited the top two players from the winter and fall schedule. He made his Masters debut in 1968, the year after he won the Memphis Open Invitational (fourth win) and tied for 11th in the PGA Championship.

This year's Masters, meanwhile, has four American professionals who have yet to win on the PGA Tour ‚Äî Sam Stevens, Johnny Keefer, Max Greyserman and Jacob Bridgeman.

Lucas Glover never looked happier than Monday at Pebble Beach, and for good reason. It was his first time walking 18 holes since Sunday of the BMW Championship at Caves Valley on Aug. 17.

Glover, 46, had surgery for a torn labrum in his left shoulder in September and planned to be back in time for the final event at Sea Island.

‚ÄúRehab went great, strength, everything good, but I was still having pain in my swing,‚Äù Glover said. ‚ÄúTurns out I had some nerve issues. The scar tissue was pinching on the nerve in pretty much the same location as the labrum.‚Äù

Six to eight weeks turned into four months. The AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am will be his first start of the year. Despite playing through a sore shoulder for the last two years, Glover still finished at No. 36 in the FedEx Cup to be eligible for the signature events.

‚ÄúI played through it, and it would come and go,‚Äù Glover said of the pain. ‚ÄúAbout the spring of ‚Äò25, it didn‚Äôt go, it kind of stayed. I had a good enough year I didn't have to play the fall and thought it was a good time to get it done. The nerve setback was a surprise.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne thing I'm not going to have to worry about in my 50s,‚Äù Glover said.

The 98-year-old Augusta Municipal Golf Course, known as The Patch, will be open for public play April 15, three days after the Masters. There will be soft opening in mid-March for Patch regulars and high school teams, and it will be open for private hospitality groups during the Masters.

Augusta National was behind a 16-month renovation by Tom Fazio and Beau Welling, and Tiger Woods built a nine-hole short course called The Loop at The Patch.

Key to the project was keeping it accessible and affordable. The 18-hole walking rate for local residents is $25, up to $35 on Friday through Sunday. The Loop fee is $15 for local residents.

The practice range is 17 acres with a Trackman range and 20 covered bays. The Putting Course has a 12-hole routing for competition.

British photographer Matthew Harris, who has covered 150 majors and 20 Ryder Cups in a career that has taken him to more than 80 countries, is being honored with the PGA of America's Lifetime Achievement Award in Photojournalism.

Harris will be honored April 8 in Augusta, Georgia, ahead of the Masters.

He covered his first European tour event at age 19 and began his 40-plus career at Golf Illustrated UK. His roots in photography date to 1974, when the 13-year-old Harris and his parents split the cost of a Pentax SP1000 camera. A year later, Harris earned second place in a photo competition for an image of Billie Jean King on the outside courts at Wimbledon.

He was there for Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy each winning the Masters for the first time. The photo that propelled his career was Seve Ballesteros winning the 1984 British Open at St. Andrews.

Tuesday is the 20-year anniversary of Tiger Woods opening his first TGR Learning Lab in Anaheim, California. The lab has served more than 200,000 students. ... The Epson Tour will offer 18-hole qualifying for three Florida events in March. Two players qualify. The tour said the field will be limited to 36 professionals. ... Scottie Scheffler and Chris Gotterup have combined to win five of the last seven PGA Tour events when both were in the field. ... Elvis Smylie went from No. 134 to No. 77 in the world ranking by winning LIV Golf Riyadh, the first event for which the Saudi-backed league was awarded ranking points.

Anthony Kim earned $203,000 for his tie for 22nd at LIV Golf Riyadh. It was his largest tournament check since he made $293,105 for a tie for fifth in the 2011 British Open.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been so scared to talk about winning, being scared I‚Äôd jinx myself, but we actually talked about it last night. We said it‚Äôs actually OK to talk about it. We‚Äôre out here to win, we‚Äôre out here to get a PGA Tour card.‚Äù ‚Äî James Nicholas after winning the Astara Golf Championship on the Korn Ferry Tour for his first win in a PGA Tour-sanctioned event.

title: Steve Spurrier's grandson, Gavin Spurrier, hired as Austin Peay QB coach
description: Austin Peay has hired Gavin Spurrier as its pass-game coordinator and quarterbacks coach. Spurrier is the grandson of Steve Spurrier.
fullText:
Austin Peay football has hired Gavin Spurrier as its passing game coordinator and quarterbacks coach, the program announced.

Spurrier, the grandson of legendary college football coach Steve Spurrier, most recently served as the assistant tight ends coach at Texas A&M.

From 2019-22, Gavin Spurrier was a walk-on quarterback at Duke, where he played under current Austin Peay coach Jeff Faris. Faris was the Blue Devils' tight ends coach and offensive recruiting coordinator from 2018-20 and served as co-offensive coordinator and QB coach in 2021.

Spurrier appeared in one game during his career at Duke and joined the coaching staff there after graduating, serving as an offensive quality control coach. When Mike Elko left Duke to become Texas A&M's coach in 2024, Spurrier followed him, and spent the last two years with the Aggies as an offensive graduate assistant.

Spurrier is the son of Steve Spurrier Jr., who is an offensive analyst at Florida. Steve Spurrier Sr. coached at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001), South Carolina (2005-15) and was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 2017.

MORE: Austin Peay hires Jordan Harmon athletic director, replacing Gerald Harrison

The Governors went 7-5 (4-4 United Athletic Conference) in 2025, their second season under Faris. Faris recently signed a contract extension through 2030. Spurrier will work with quarterback Chris Parson, who racked up 3,746 total yards and 37 touchdowns last season and was named a finalist for the Walter Payton Award, which goes to the top offensive player in FCS.

APSU also announced three other staff hires on Feb. 9: chief of staff Christian Mitchell, defensive line coach Darien Moody and wide receiver coach Johnathan Lloyd.

Jacob Shames can be reached by email at jshames@gannett.com and on X/Twitter @Jacob_Shames.

This article originally appeared on Clarksville Leaf-Chronicle: Austin Peay hires Gavin Spurrier, Steve Spurrier's grandson, as QB coach

title: Harry Maguire throws shade at Amorim‚Äôs style while praising Carrick
description: Manchester United have won four games on the bounce under Michael Carrick, something the team never managed under former head coach Ruben Amorim.Michael Carrick has restored the club‚Äôs DNA, with the...
fullText:
Manchester United have won four games on the bounce under Michael Carrick, something the team never managed under former head coach Ruben Amorim.

Michael Carrick has restored the club‚Äôs DNA, with the Red Devils winning games late on while breaking down stubborn defences with ease.

The manner of the four victories and the opposition they have come against have impressed one and all, including United players.

Harry Maguire was asked about what Carrick got right instantly as opposed to the Portuguese, and the former skipper pointed to the work rate put in by the players as a unit while defending.

He cited the team‚Äôs defending in the box, claiming the 20-time English league champions are far more aggressive now as compared to under Amorim.

‚ÄúI think we‚Äôve got to be comfortable to be dominant with the ball but also without the ball and also be a threat,‚Äô Maguire told TNT Sports. ‚ÄúWe also know we‚Äôre going to be a threat on the counter-attack with our players.

‚ÄúTaking the lead against Manchester City and then we were happy to soak up a little bit of pressure and be comfortable defending our box.

‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs the main thing that‚Äôs improved over the last three games. We‚Äôve defended our box a lot better with a lot more urgency. Previously we defended our box nowhere near good enough, every time the ball went in the box they had a chance.

‚ÄúBut the last three games, loads more urgency. Not just from the defenders, from the midfielders, the wide men getting back in, the strikers protecting the edge of the box, I think it‚Äôs so important we do it as a team.‚Äù

The most important change has been United‚Äôs tactical flexibility, as opposed to playing in Amorim‚Äôs rigid 3-4-3 system.

Under the former United midfielder, the Old Trafford side have played a fluid front four, while playing in a different way in each game.

United defended narrow against Manchester City and Arsenal, while looking to play on the counter. It was a different approach against both Fulham and Tottenham Hotspur, where they enjoyed more of the ball.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got to make sure we get the spaces right all over the pitch. We‚Äôve got to make sure we‚Äôre compact, in a mid block, a low block or we go after teams.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure under Sir Alex [Ferguson] you went after some teams and you were happy in the mid block and happy defending low. I think Michael will bring that.I think there‚Äôll be times going man-for-man all over the pitch and be really aggressive.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôll also be times we‚Äôll be happy and content keeping the spaces short and punishing teams on the counter-attack. I think it‚Äôs important to be tactically flexible.‚Äù

United will now look to make it five wins out of five when they travel to London to face West Ham United later on Tuesday.

Feature image Carl Recine via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Taubitz extends Germany's Olympic luge dominance with gold, Farquharson gets bronze for US
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Julia Taubitz added a new chapter to Germany's Olympic luge dominance.  Elina Bota made some history for Latvia.  Taubitz rolled to the win in the women's singles race at the Milan Cortina Olympics, finishing her two-day, four-run strut to the gold in 3 minutes, 30.625 seconds ‚Äî nearly a full second ahead of Bota, who got the silver.
fullText:
CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Julia Taubitz added a new chapter to Germany's Olympic luge dominance. Elina Bota made some history for Latvia.

And Ashley Farquharson was moved to tears ‚Äî after giving USA Luge just the seventh medal in its Olympic history.

Taubitz rolled to the win in the women's singles race at the Milan Cortina Olympics, finishing her two-day, four-run strut to the gold in 3 minutes, 30.625 seconds ‚Äî nearly a full second ahead of Bota, who got the silver.

Farquharson got the bronze, the third singles medal ever for USA Luge at the Olympics and matching the best finish by an American women's slider. Chris Mazdzer got silver in men's singles at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games, and Erin Hamlin got the women's bronze at the 2014 Sochi Olympics.

This time, it was Farquharson's turn.

Taubitz got the 17th gold medal awarded in women's singles luge, and the 13th that went to a German slider.

The Olympic singles gold medal was the only thing missing on Taubitz's resume.

She's a two-time women's singles world champion, a five-time World Cup overall champion, a winner of more than 30 World Cup races and none of that takes into account how she has piled up medals as part of Germany's near-unbeatable team relays.

And now, the biggest medal. The shiniest one, too. She's the Olympic champion, taking over that crown from now-retired German great Natalie Geisenberger, who won the last three gold medals.

Emily Fischnaller was 12th for the Americans in 3:33.035, falling from fifth after three runs with some trouble in her final heat. Summer Britcher of the U.S., a two-time World Cup race winner this season and now a four-time Olympian, was 14th in 3:33.553.

Taubitz and Fraebel were so far ahead of the field entering Tuesday that the only way they wouldn't win gold and silver was if someone committed a huge mistake.

It took about one second for her gold chance ‚Äî or any medal chance ‚Äî to be gone. Fraebel badly botched the start of her third run, bouncing off the wall and ping-ponging her way down the rest of the track. She went from second entering the third run to 10th entering the last, way out of medal contention.

And that meant, for the fourth run, Taubitz didn't even have to get into fourth gear. With a lead of 0.704 seconds going into the final heat, there was no doubt that Taubitz would get gold.

title: Justin Verlander signs with Detroit Tigers for 1 year, $13 million
description: Justin Verlander, former Detroit Tigers Cy Young winner and MVP, is returning to the team he played for from 2005-17, on a 1-year, $13 million deal.
fullText:
Justin Verlander is coming home.

The Detroit Tigers signed Verlander on Tuesday, Feb. 10, to a one-year, $13 million contract for the 2026 season. The deal includes $11 million in deferred payments, starting in 2030.

The Tigers selected Verlander with the No. 2 overall pick in the 2004 draft, and he pitched for the Tigers from 2005-17.

In 2025, Verlander posted a 3.85 ERA with 52 walks and 137 strikeouts across 152 innings in 29 starts for the San Francisco Giants.

title: Report: Rams expected to hire Tennessee's Michael Hunter as DBs coach
description: The Los Angeles Rams added another new member to their coaching staff.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Rams could be making another big coaching decision this offseason.

CBS Sports' Matt Zenitz reported Tuesday that L.A. is expected to hire Michael Hunter as the Rams' next defensive coordinator. Hunter was hired to coach cornerbacks at the University of Tennessee after spending the past two seasons as an assistant defensive backs coach at Ohio State from 2024 to 2025.

It's unclear how this role is related to Aubrey Pleasant, who was previously the Rams' defensive backs coach before becoming the assistant head coach and passing game coordinator in 2025. Pleasant has been interviewing for defensive coordinator positions with the Arizona Cardinals and the Cleveland Browns this offseason. In theory, Hunter could serve as a defensive backs coach even if Pleasant stays.

Hunter has only coached in the college ranks, but spent four years in the NFL as a defensive back. He mostly played on the practice squad, though. Hunter saw action in six regular-season games over two seasons for the New York Giants from 2016 to 2017, splitting time between the defense and special teams.

The Rams need all the help they can get in the secondary after the unit broke down toward the end of the year. While general manager Les Snead noted that the team will "attack" the secondary positions this offseason, adding another coach could help as well.

Hunter would be the third coaching change this offseason after the Rams revamped their special teams staff with Bubba Ventrone and Kyle Hoke. Head coach Sean McVay will need to replace his offensive coordinator, too, after Mike LaFleur took the Cardinals' head coaching job.

This article originally appeared on Rams Wire: Report: Rams expected to hire Tennessee's Michael Hunter as DBs coach

title: Chargers to hire Rutgers OLB coach as new Asst. DL coach

fullText:
The Chargers have been steadily hiring new offensive coaches over the past two weeks and on Tuesday it was reported that they‚Äôre adding a new name on the defensive staff.

Per ESPN‚Äôs Pete Thamel, the Bolts are hiring Rutgers outside linebackers coach Julian Campenni as their new assistant defensive line coach. He has spent the past two seasons with the Scarlet Knights and the prior five seasons at Bowling Green.

Sources: The Chargers are hiring Rutgers OLB coach Julian Campenni as an assistant defensive line coach. He‚Äôs spent the last two years at Rutgers, and spent the prior five seasons at Bowling Green. He‚Äôs a former UConn player and GA at Boston College. pic.twitter.com/PAzMY2lubc

Campenni is a former defensive lineman at UConn who played in 47 career games with 38 starts. He was named a team captain and was a Second-Team All-CUSA pick in 2015. After his playing career, Campenni began coaching at the high school level in Pennsylvania before going to be a graduate assistant at Boston College.

Rutgers‚Äô top pass rusher in 2025 was Eric O‚ÄôNeill, a former James Madison standout in 2024 who spent his final season with the Scarlet Knights. O‚ÄôNeill posted team highs of 9.5 tackles for loss and 2.5 sacks.

title: Injured Lillard Headlines Sportsbooks‚Äô Favorites for NBA All-Star Weekend
description: Damian Lillard has yet to play this season due to a torn Achilles but is the favorite to win the 3-Point Contest on Saturday.
fullText:
As NBA All-Star Weekend approaches, sportsbooks have set the stage with favorites and underdogs in the 3-Point Contest, Slam Dunk contest, and other festivities.

Lillard has a 54.5% implied chance to reach the 3-Point Contest final.

Three of the four Slam Dunk contest participants are rookies.

The NBA will host the first ever three-team All-Star Game tournament.

After an estimated $1.76 billion was wagered on Super Bowl LX, the NBA world heads into its celebratory midyear pause.

This time of year is known for high-flying acts in the Slam Dunk contest, precision sharpshooting in the 3-Point Contest, the craftsmanship of the Skills Challenge, and, for the first time ever, a three-team All-Star Game tournament.

Kicking it off with the Slam Dunk contest, the top online sportsbooks can‚Äôt decide on a consensus favorite.

Gone are the days of the NBA‚Äôs biggest and brightest stars competing in the contest. Bryant, Johnson, and Richardson are all rookies, leaving 25-year-old and seven-year veteran Hayes as the group‚Äôs senior.

Hayes is also the most productive of the quartet, averaging a modest 6.5 points per game. However, he‚Äôs thrown down several highlight-worthy dunks in his career, including an Eastbay on Jan. 26.

This isn't Jaxson Hayes' first Eastbay...

He went between the legs for the slam on April 2, 2024 ü§Ø https://t.co/9IhnKU2Hr0 pic.twitter.com/x6DBABBBdr

The 3-Point Contest, meanwhile, is headlined by a player who could provide one of the best All-Star Weekend storylines in recent memory.

Lillard hasn‚Äôt appeared in an NBA game since he tore his Achilles in the Eastern Conference quarterfinals April 27. Despite that, he finds himself as the favorite or co-favorite at the two top sportsbooks and the only player with minus-money odds (-120) at FanDuel to qualify for the final round.

The longtime Portland Trail Blazers stalwart won the event in 2023 and 2024.

Damian Lillard wins the NBA Three-Point Contest üî•pic.twitter.com/0MCKjFOs7y

‚Äî Daily Loud (@DailyLoud) February 19, 2023

Notably, Charlotte Hornets rookie Kon Knueppel is second. A win would make him the first player in franchise history to hoist the trophy.

The Skills Challenge is being replaced by the Shooting Stars competition, which has not been seen at All-Star Weekend since 2015.

The competition will see three-person teams compete to score points by nailing jumpers from designated areas on the court. The last team to win was Team Bosh, which consisted of Chris Bosh, Dominique Wilkins, and Swin Cash.

Teams competing in this year‚Äôs event include:

Team Knicks: Jalen Brunson, Karl-Anthony Towns, Allan Houston
Team Cameron: Kon Kneuppel, Jalen Johnson, Corey Maggette
Team All-Stars: Scottie Barnes, Chet Holmgren, Richard Hamilton
Team Harper: Dylan Harper, Ron Harper, Ron Harper Jr.

The new All-Star Game round-robin tournament will see three teams compete in four 12-minute games. The top two teams based on the aggregate score of their matchups will advance to the championship round, where they will play a final 12-minute contest.

While FanDuel and DraftKings are split on which team will win the mini-tournament, they agree that USA Stars are the long shot.

The teams and individuals who will take the floor include:

USA Stars: Scottie Barnes, Devin Booker, Cade Cunningham, Jalen Duren, Anthony Edwards, Chet Holmgren, Jalen Johnson, Tyrese Maxey
USA Stripes: Jaylen Brown, Jalen Brunson, Brandon Ingram, Kevin Durant, LeBron James, Kawhi Leonard, Donovan Mitchell, Norman Powell
World: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Deni Avdija, Luka Doncic, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Nikola Jokic, Jamal Murray, Alperen Sengun, Pascal Siakam, Karl-Anthony Towns, Victor Wembanyama

title: Tottenham vs. Newcastle score, stats, talking points, highlights for Premier League match
description: Two Premier League teams absolutely desperate for points at all costs will clash in London as Tottenham host Newcastle on Tuesday.

Two Premier League teams absolutely desperate for points at all costs will clash in London as Tottenham host Newcastle on Tuesday.

Both clubs are suffering through poor runs of form and are in need of any positive results, giving this match a nervy and tense feel.

The hosts are in the most dire situation, languishing¬†15th in the league standings, just six points above the drop as Thomas Frank is on thin ice at Spurs.

For Eddie Howe and the visiting Magpies, they aren't under threat of relegation, but their position in 12th leaves their chances of qualifying for Europe next season on life support. Their total of 33 points through 25 matches puts them 10 points back of fifth-place Chelsea, meaning a shot at a Champions League place next year is almost certainly out of the question.

title: Mike Perry opens up on the moment that sparked BKFC crowd brawl with Eddie Alvarez
description: Mike Perry has shed light on what led to the altercation between him and Eddie Alvarez in the crowd this past weekend. Since leaving the UFC in 2021, Perry has become a standout name in Conor McGregor‚Äôs BKFC promotion.
fullText:
Mike Perry has shed light on what led to the altercation between him and Eddie Alvarez in the crowd this past weekend.

Since leaving the UFC in 2021, Perry has become a standout name in Conor McGregor‚Äôs BKFC promotion.

He has built a strong record in BKFC, racking up six wins in six fights, with notable victories over Michael ‚ÄòVenom‚Äô Page, Luke Rockhold, and Alvarez among them.

Although he was not on the card for Knuckle Mania 6, Perry still found himself at the centre of attention after getting into it with ‚ÄòThe Underground King‚Äô.

This past Saturday in Philadelphia, chaos broke out early during BKFC Knuckle Mania 6, with brawls erupting among fans before the first fight had even started.

Things escalated further when Perry and Alvarez got into it as well. The two had previously met in the BKFC ring back in 2023, where Perry came out on top via a second-round corner stoppage.

This time though, footage made the rounds showing Alvarez getting the better of it before security stepped in to separate them.

On Monday, Perry spoke about the incident on X, saying: ‚ÄúThey welcomed me to Philly as one of their own, and that floor was slippery as heck.‚Äù

‚ÄúHis wife fell on her face, and I laughed at her looks like I was just down underneath everybody slipping for the first minute, told ya‚Äôll, eventful.‚Äù

When questioned what started the brawl, Perry simply answered: ‚ÄúVodka.‚Äù

Lorenzo Hunt added another knockout to his record on Saturday night, reclaiming his spot as BKFC‚Äôs pound-for-pound top fighter in the process.

After the event, Hunt and Perry got into a heated faceoff during the post-fight press conference, needing security to step in. The exchange has already sparked talk of a future match-up between them.

title: Warriors' Draymond Green discusses being floated in trade talks
description: Draymond Green opened up on finding out he was being floated in trade talks by the Golden State Warriors
fullText:
Leading up to the Feb. 5 trade deadline, the Golden State Warriors were heavily featured in rumors surrounding a trade for Giannis Antetokounmpo. A deal for the two-time MVP ultimately never materialized, and he remains with the Milwaukee Bucks. However, during the reported trade discussions, the Warriors were faced with a difficult choice of potentially parting with either Draymond Green or Jimmy Butler for salary-matching purposes.

During a recent episode of "The Draymond Green Show," the veteran forward admitted that he'd had a conversation with Mike Dunleavy. Green recalled that Dunleavy explained that he could potentially be traded before the deadline, should a move for Giannis pick up pace.

"I called ,and he asked me about a couple of deals. What do you think of this deal? What do you think of that deal? ...And we talked for quite a while," Green said. "And then he's like, 'And by the way, on Giannis' front, like, obviously we spoke to Giannis, spoke about Giannis. We've talked about what pics we'd send them.' We haven't talked about really the players that will go into the deal, but obviously If we were to do a deal with Giannis, you or Jimmy would have to be in the trade just to make it work. But we're not even there yet. We're not that far down the road. I'm not even sure it's going to happen anyway."

"'But just so you know, all the speculation out there and what people are saying, some of it's true.' I'm like, 'all right, cool.' But what it said to me in that moment was, okay, there's a chance I may get traded for Giannis because he didn't rule it out. He didn't say, we're not putting you in a deal. He said, there's a chance that you or Jimmy would have to go on a deal. So I took that ass, alright. It'll probably be me."

Golden State ultimately landed Kristaps Porzingis via trade. Mike Dunleavy Jr. and Joe Lacob might explore a potential move for Giannis during the summer. But for now, Green's long-term partnership with the franchise is set to continue.

Whether that changes in the summer remains to be seen. But, if both Stephen Curry and Porzingis can remain healthy, the Warriors should be capable of enjoying a potentially successful second half of the season and postseason run.

This post originally appeared on¬†Warriors Wire!
